entries.title: WATCH:  Happy New Year Greece!
entries.description: Fireworks display near the Acropolis as Athens rings in the new year.

entries.title: WATCH:  New Year's celebration in Germany
entries.description: Berlin rings in the New Year with fireworks celebration over the Brandenburg Gate.

entries.title: 3 Indianapolis officers shoot man apparently sleeping in car
entries.description: Two Indianapolis police investigations are underway after three officers shot a man who appeared to have been sleeping in his car

entries.title: 15 dead, 47 injured in western Mexico bus crash
entries.description: Fifteen people are dead and 47 are being treated for their injuries after a bus carrying holiday season tourists flipped on a highway in Mexico's Pacific coast state of Nayarit

entries.title: Power failures amplify calls for utility to rethink gas
entries.description: A federal utility’s decision to resort to rolling blackouts after coal and natural gas units went offline during dangerously cold conditions has intensified questions about the Tennessee Valley Authority’s recent decision to double down on fossil fuels

entries.title: New York OKs human composting law; 6th state in US to do so
entries.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul has signed a law making her state the sixth in the nation to allow human composting as a method of burial

entries.title: On New Year's, Putin slams West for hypocrisy, aggression
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin has used his New Year’s address to the nation to accuse Western countries of aggression and trying to use the conflict in Ukraine to undermine Moscow

entries.title: City declares weeklong emergency curfew after 'rampage of shootings'
entries.description: Officials in the small city of Eudora, Arkansas, are enforcing an emergency curfew after struggling to stop what the city’s mayor described as a “rampage of shootings.”

entries.title: Troubles aside, Xi says China on 'right side of history'
entries.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping says his country is on the “right side of history" in a New Year's address that comes as questions swirl over his government's handling of COVID-19 and economic and political challenges

entries.title: Despite war, some Ukrainian families reunite for New Year
entries.description: For millions of Ukrainians, many of them under Russian bombardment and grappling with power and water shortages, New Year's celebrations will be muted as Russia’s 10-month war rumbles on with no end in sight

entries.title: 13 bison dead after truck hits herd near Yellowstone park
entries.description: Thirteen bison were killed or had to be euthanized after they were struck by a semi-truck involved in an accident with two other vehicles on a dark Montana highway just outside Yellowstone National Park

entries.title: Another woman files sex abuse lawsuit against Cosby, NBC
entries.description: A woman who alleges Bill Cosby drugged and sexually assaulted her in 1986 has sued the comedian-actor, NBCUniversal and other companies in New York, where five other women filed a similar lawsuit earlier this month

entries.title: China faces bumpy road to normal as infections surge
entries.description: China is on a bumpy road back to normal life as schools, shopping malls and restaurants fill up again with the easing of COVID-19 restriction

entries.title: Pope Benedict XVI has died at the age of 95
entries.description: He was widely seen as a conservative who was in line with Pope John Paul.

entries.title: Mega Millions jackpot numbers drawn
entries.description: The numbers for the Mega Millions jackpot that has soared to an estimated $685 million were drawn Friday night.

entries.title: Barbara Walters, trailblazing TV icon, dies at 93
entries.description: Barbara Walters, the trailblazing news broadcaster, has died at 93.

entries.title: ICE arrests doubled in 2022, agency reports
entries.description: Immigrations and Customs Enforcement (ICE) released a report Friday that showed that it doubled its arrests in 2022.

entries.title: Andrew Tate detained on human trafficking, rape charges for 30 days
entries.description: Controversial internet personality Andrew Tate will be detained in Romania for 30 days on charges of human trafficking and rape, officials said.

entries.title: Court: Abortion doctors can’t be charged under Arizona law
entries.description: An Arizona court ruled abortion doctors can’t be prosecuted under a pre-statehood law that criminalizes nearly all abortions yet was barred from being enforced for decades
